title: Goa club fire: Owner Gaurav Luthra spotted at Thailand airport; 1st image out
content: Goa nightclub owners, Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, have fled to Thailand following a devastating fire that killed 25 people. Authorities issued a Look Out Circular and are coordinating with Interpol for their arrest.  Meanwhile, a third individual, Bharat Kohli, has been apprehended in Delhi and handed over to Goa police.

title: 'IndiGo back on its feet': CEO says ops stable; airline focusing on what led to crisis
content: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers assures operations are stabilizing after a recent crisis, with refunds issued and flights restored to all 138 destinations. The Civil Aviation Minister holds IndiGo accountable, emphasizing passenger convenience. The DGCA has mandated a 5% cut in IndiGo's winter schedule due to operational inefficiencies, with further reductions possible as the airline works to stabilize.

title: Gill, Sudarshan, and gaps around them: What puzzles must GT solve at auction
content: With only 5 wins in 14 matches and a win percentage of 41.7, the 2024 season was a disaster for the Gujarat Titans as they finished 8th in the point table. However, GT had a good season last year after the mega auction and qualified for the playoffs, but were defeated in the Eliminator by the Mumbai Indians (MI).

title: Goa club fire: Shack owned by Luthra brothers to be razed; interpol notice out
content: Goa orders demolition of Romeo Lane nightclub after a fire killed 25. Investigations suggest deaths were avoidable, with senior IPS officers allegedly intervening to block previous notices and FIRs against the club. Call records of implicated officers may link them to club owners.

title: What Pakistan Googled in 2025: Abhishek Sharma, iPhone 17 & more; top searches listed
content: Pakistan's 2025 Google searches reveal a keen interest in AI like Gemini and Grok, alongside the latest iPhone 17. Cricket fever dominated with Pakistan vs. South Africa leading the pack. Abhishek Sharma topped athlete searches, while local news focused on socio-economic registries and flood situations. Dramas like 'Sher' and 'Judwaa' captured viewers' attention.

title: 'Was eying my elder daughter': Live-in partner slits techie's throat; calls cops to confess
content: A 35-year-old engineer was murdered by his 46-year-old live-in partner and her two daughters in Lucknow. The woman confessed to slitting his throat after an argument over his alleged "inappropriate intentions" towards her elder daughter. The deceased had been tutoring the daughters since 2012.

title: Will JEE Main and CUET shift to pen-and-paper after new recommendations by the parliamentary panel?
content: A parliamentary standing committee has highlighted repeated disruptions in major NTA exams, including UGC-NET, CSIR-NET, NEET-PG, NEET-UG, CUET and JEE Main. The panel recommended a shift towards pen-and-paper testing, citing successful CBSE and UPSC models, and urged that CBTs be held only in government-controlled centres. It also called for a nationwide blacklist of tainted vendors and advised using NTA’s Rs 448-crore surplus to strengthen internal exam capabilities and regulatory systems.

title: 'Falling' for him: Mistress dangles from 10th-floor balcony in China after lover’s wife returns home — Watch
content: A woman, reportedly a mistress, narrowly escaped a perilous fall from a 10th-floor balcony in China after her lover's wife arrived unexpectedly. Witnesses watched in horror as she dangled precariously before sliding down drainpipes and windowsills to safety.  The incident, captured on video, has sparked widespread online discussion and embarrassment for those involved.

title: ‘Love my job’: Apple’s chip head Srouji dismisses exit rumours; confirms he’s staying
content: Apple's hardware chief Johny Srouji has confirmed he's staying, dispelling departure rumors and offering relief to CEO Tim Cook. This crucial retention comes amid an unprecedented executive exodus, with six key leaders having left recently. Srouji's decision is a significant win for Cook as Apple navigates leadership changes and the AI race.

title: 'You were working for Britishers': Kharge flays BJP; Vande Mataram debate rages in RS
content: Rajya Sabha session on Vande Mataram's 150 years turned combative as Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge accused BJP's predecessors of working for the British. Home minister Amit Shah rejected claims of political timing, urging members to view the song's significance beyond elections.

title: 'Cheap sensationalism': Mahieka photographed inappropriately; Pandya hits out at paparazzi
content: Hardik Pandya strongly condemned paparazzi for intrusive photography of Mahieka Sharma, calling it disrespectful and cheap sensationalism. He urged the media to be more mindful and respect boundaries, emphasising that not everything needs to be captured. Meanwhile, Pandya is nearing a T20I milestone of 2,000 runs and 100 wickets.

title: Want to use your old smartphone as a home security camera? How to set it up
content: Transform your old smartphone into a home security camera with a simple app. This cost-effective DIY solution allows you to monitor your home, children, or pets remotely. By installing a security app on your old phone and your current device, you can set up a functional surveillance system. While convenient, be aware of limitations compared to professional cameras.

title: Indonesia fire: Massive blaze engulfs seven-story office building in Jakarta; 20 killed
content: A devastating fire ripped through a seven-storey office building in Jakarta, claiming at least 20 lives as smoke trapped workers inside. Flames erupted in the afternoon, spreading quickly and causing widespread panic. Firefighters battled the inferno, with dense smoke engulfing the area. Efforts to find survivors continued amidst the tragedy.

title: Security scare at Vijay's rally: Man held with gun at TVK event — key details
content: A man carrying a licensed handgun was detained at a Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam rally in Puducherry after tight security was implemented following a fatal stampede. The rally, restricted to 5,000 attendees with QR codes, saw large crowds gather outside, with party functionaries clashing with police over entry restrictions.

title: 'India in Reform Express phase': PM hails rapid changes; focus on 'ease of life'
content: Prime Minister Modi declared India is in a "Reform Express" phase, prioritising citizen well-being and ease of life alongside business. He urged MPs to address ground-level issues, aiming to simplify governance by reducing bureaucratic hurdles and paperwork. The PM also voiced concern over IndiGo's flight disruptions, emphasizing that system improvements shouldn't inconvenience the public.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection day 5: Ranveer starrer inches towards Rs 140 crore
content: Aditya Dhar's directorial 'Dhurandhar', featuring Ranveer Singh and a stellar cast, has taken the box office by storm, crossing ₹100 crore in its opening weekend. The film witnessed impressive growth, with Sunday collections soaring to ₹43 crore. While Monday saw a natural dip, the movie continues to perform strongly, accumulating ₹129.

title: 5% cut: Government finally aligns IndiGo flights with airline's operating ability
content: IndiGo faces a 5% cut in its winter flight schedule from the DGCA. The airline failed to operate its approved flights efficiently. This reduction impacts high-demand routes. IndiGo must submit a revised schedule soon. Other airlines like Air India and Akasa also saw schedule reductions. SpiceJet, however, increased its operations.

title: Trump’s tariff threat on Indian rice! Why US, not India, has more to worry - explained
content: US President Trump has threatened further tariffs on Indian rice, accusing India of 'dumping' products. Despite existing high tariffs, Indian rice exports to the US remain strong, particularly premium basmati. Experts suggest this is election-season messaging, as increased duties would primarily impact American consumers and not significantly harm Indian exporters.

title: 'Burning' empire: Goa nightclub blaze that toppled Luthra brothers; how nightlife kingdom collapsed
content: A decade-old restaurant venture, Romeo Lane, expanded rapidly across India and Dubai, attracting mall developers and franchisees. However, a devastating fire at a Goa outlet, which killed 25, exposed alleged safety violations and a lack of oversight, sparking public outrage and questions of accountability for the Luthra brothers.

title: Odisha village tense after woman found beheaded: Mob torches 150 homes; internet cut
content: In the wake of a disturbing crime, tensions erupted in the Malkangiri district of Odisha as an Adivasi community took drastic action against a village of settlers from Bangladesh, prompted by the discovery of a woman's beheaded body. Fueled by suspicions of a land dispute, the enraged mob set around 150 homes ablaze.

title: 'Why Sunny Leone?': Ashwin's cryptic post leaves fans guessing; until real 'Sunny' emerges
content: Ravichandran Ashwin's cryptic social media post, a visual pun combining Sunny Leone and Sadhu Street, baffled fans until they realised it was a tribute to young cricketer Sunny Sandhu. Sandhu's match-winning cameo in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy earned him this unique endorsement, potentially boosting his profile ahead of the IPL 2026 auction.

title: 'IndiGo being held accountable': Aviation minister in Parliament; assures 'ops stabilising'
content: Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu stated in Lok Sabha that IndiGo is being held accountable for its operational crisis, with services rapidly stabilizing. He assured that passenger convenience and dignity are being protected, and long-term measures are in place to enhance India's aviation sector, emphasizing no airline will be permitted to inconvenience passengers.

title: Right to Disconnect Bill 2025: What it means for employees in India - explained
content: India’s Right to Disconnect Bill 2025 empowers employees to ignore work communications outside official hours without facing penalties. Introduced by NCP MP Supriya Sule, the bill proposes an Employees’ Welfare Authority to monitor compliance, investigate complaints, and impose fines on non-compliant firms. Similar laws exist in France, Italy, Portugal, and Australia, ensuring work-life balance, while the U.S. lacks comprehensive protections. The legislation addresses burnout, digital overload, and the need for clear boundaries between professional and personal life.

title: 'Bacchey bade ho jate hain': Wasim Akram takes dig at IPL duration, calls PSL No.1
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Wasim Akram sparked debate by suggesting the IPL's extended duration becomes monotonous, contrasting it with the Pakistan Super League's shorter, more appealing format for international players. He cited the Big Bash League's shift to a shorter window as evidence, emphasizing the PSL's bowling depth and competitive edge.

title: 'Rules are good but ... ': PM weighs in on IndiGo chaos; stresses people must not face trouble
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi stressed that rules must aid, not harass the public, amidst IndiGo's ongoing flight crisis. The airline's operational issues stem from new pilot rest rules, impacting thousands of passengers. Union minister Kiren Rijiju conveyed the PM's concern, emphasising passenger convenience and urging MPs to focus on public-centric reforms.

title: ‘8888 is lucky’: Haryana IT executive bids Rs 1.17cr for VIP number; backs out later
content: IT executive Sudhir, who bid over Rs 1.1 crore for VIP number HR88B-8888, now claims the number is not worth the price and he will not bid again. He cited astrological advice for his interest in the number, but intense bidding pushed him to the final amount. Sudhir welcomes any probe into the matter.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Bengaluru data analyst dies while trying to retrieve his phone
content: A 25-year-old Bengaluru man, Mohammed Ishaq, tragically died in a Goa nightclub fire early Sunday morning. He was on a bachelor party trip with friends and reportedly went back inside the club to retrieve his phone. His body showed minor burns, and police stated he died in a stampede while exiting.

title: DGCA cuts IndiGo flight schedules by 5%; 115 daily flights reduced — what it means
content: The aviation regulator DGCA has reduced IndiGo's flights by five percent. This decision follows a period of significant flight cancellations. IndiGo's operations were impacted by new pilot duty rules and an increase in flights. Other airlines saw minor adjustments to their schedules. Aviation authorities are reviewing the situation.

title: Flying to US? FBI wants you to set secret family code words
content: The FBI has issued a warning about a surge in virtual kidnapping scams, where criminals use altered proof-of-life media to extort victims. Scammers falsely claim to have kidnapped a loved one, demanding immediate ransom reinforced by threats. Travelers are advised to establish a code word and contact loved ones directly before paying.

title: 'Who is better than Rohit & Virat?' - Ex-cricketer warns India against sidelining icons
content: Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh has a clear message for Indian cricket selectors. He believes Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli should be central to planning for the 2027 ODI World Cup. Harbhajan insists the team should be built around these proven match-winners. He argues that sidelining them for youth could be detrimental in crucial matches.

title: Tim Pool reports shooting at his home as podcast-related controversy escalates
content: Tim Pool reported shots fired at his West Virginia home on December 5, hours after a podcast episode featuring Milo Yiannopoulos made unverified claims about Erika and Charlie Kirk. Pool's security team is reviewing footage, and he suggested the incident was meant to intimidate. Authorities have not yet confirmed the shooting.

title: Nick Fuentes defends using racist slur against Usha Vance — watch
content: Far-right commentator Nick Fuentes faced scrutiny from Piers Morgan for racist remarks targeting Second Lady Usha Vance's Indian heritage. Fuentes defended his comments by claiming supporters of JD Vance are racist and that he was highlighting hypocrisy. He previously mocked a Thanksgiving photo of Vance's family, making disparaging remarks about their Indian heritage.

title: ‘Desperate for a son’: Karnataka man chops wife’s hair; burns it in graveyard
content: A shocking incident unfolded in Vijayapura where a husband, desperate for a male heir, allegedly followed a sorceress's bizarre advice. He reportedly cut his wife's hair, causing a scalp injury, and then burnt it in a graveyard.

title: Kerala rape survivor stood firm over memory card breach, assault video accessed illegally thrice
content: In the actor rape case, the survivor's fight for justice faced a setback as a memory card containing assault visuals was accessed without authorization. The High Court noted the violation of her fundamental privacy rights, with a fact-finding report revealing court officials accessed the card, causing immense emotional harm.

title: 'No other player like Hardik Pandya': Ex-batting coach says he unlocks India's best combination
content: India's T20 World Cup title defence receives a major boost with Hardik Pandya's return. Former coach Sanjay Bangar believes Pandya's unique all-round abilities are crucial for the team's balanced XI. Shubman Gill also returns after recovering from a neck spasm. Jitesh Sharma is tipped for the number seven spot. Pandya's availability allows for preferred spin options without compromising batting depth.

title: 'New science?' Kejriwal mocks CM Rekha Gupta’s ‘AQI is temperature’ remark
content: Aam Aadmi Party leader Arvind Kejriwal has questioned Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta's scientific basis for claims on air pollution, particularly her assertion that AQI is a type of temperature. Gupta defended water spraying at pollution hotspots as a solution, a practice she stated was also employed by previous governments.

title: 'You start your innings on zero': Smriti Mandhana's comment goes viral
content: Smriti Mandhana's past interview on dealing with setbacks has resurfaced following the announcement that her wedding to Palash Muchhal has been called off. In the clip, she shared her strategy of focusing on short-term goals and routine to overcome difficult phases.

title: Luthra brothers flee to Thailand: Goa police issue blue corner notice
content: Goa police have issued a blue corner notice for nightclub owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, who fled to Thailand shortly after a fire incident. The brothers reportedly left Delhi for Phuket just hours after the blaze, indicating an attempt to evade authorities.  Authorities are coordinating with Interpol for their swift apprehension.

title: Sherry and Daljot: Shooters behind attack on Kapil Sharma's Kap's Café revealed; duo linked to Bishnoi gang, Seepu gave orders
content: Central agencies and Canadian police are actively searching for Sharry and Diljot Rehal, two alleged shooters linked to the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. The duo is accused of carrying out multiple firing incidents at comedian Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe in Surrey and Mumbai. Investigations reveal a mastermind, Seepu, orchestrated these attacks, with an arrested associate providing logistical support.

title: 'They can't do that': New tariffs amid trade talks? Trump asks why India is 'allowed to dump rice in US'
content: US President Donald Trump has signaled potential new tariffs on Indian rice imports, questioning why New Delhi faces no additional duties. This comes as he announced a $12 billion aid package for American farmers struggling with falling prices and import competition. The move adds a fresh trade friction point ahead of upcoming bilateral talks.

title: Prem Chopra’s health update: Actor treated for severe Aortic Stenosis with TAVI procedure
content: Veteran actor Prem Chopra, known for his villainous roles, has successfully recovered after undergoing a TAVI procedure for severe Aortic Stenosis. His son-in-law, Sharman Joshi, shared the encouraging update, thanking the doctors for their expertise. Prem Chopra is now back home and feeling much better, much to the relief of his fans.

title: IND vs SA: India’s final run before T20 WC starts; SKY leads squad tune-up mission
content: Team India gears up for the T20 World Cup with a five-match series against South Africa, marking the return of key players Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya. Suryakumar Yadav's team aims to fine-tune their champion squad, while South Africa welcome back Anrich Nortje. The Barabati Stadium pitch is expected to favour batters, promising a run-fest.

title: Chargers pull ahead in OT to defeat Eagles in tight MNF win
content: It was the biggest win of the season for a Chargers team that appeared to be spiraling out of playoff contention.

title: Hurts has 2 turnovers on 1 play amid 4-INT night
content: Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts became the first player since 1978 -- as far back as research goes -- to commit two turnovers on the same play during Monday night's overtime loss to the Chargers.

title: Bolts laud injured Herbert's gritty effort in OT win
content: One week after having surgery for a fracture in his left hand, Chargers QB Justin Herbert stiff-armed the Eagles in a 22-19 overtime win on "Monday Night Football." "It felt like we were in a movie," Chargers coach Jim Harbaugh said.

title: Sources: Ailing Colts to work out retired QB Rivers
content: The Indianapolis Colts will work out retired quarterback Philip Rivers on Tuesday, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: 4 LSU coaches rejoin Rebels for CFP run
content: Sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Monday that four current LSU offensive assistants are joining offensive coordinator Charlie Weis Jr. at Ole Miss to help prepare the Rebels for their College Football Playoff appearance, which begins Dec. 20 vs. Tulane.

title: Notre Dame AD: ACC caused 'permanent damage'
content: Notre Dame's AD ripped the ACC after its CFP snub, saying the conference that houses almost every Fighting Irish team has caused "permanent damage" to the relationship.

title: Mendoza, Pavia, Love, Sayin in Heisman's final 4
content: After leading Indiana to its first Big Ten title in 58 years, Fernando Mendoza was announced as a Heisman Trophy finalist Monday, joining Vanderbilt quarterback Diego Pavia, Notre Dame running back Jeremiyah Love and Ohio State quarterback Julian Sayin.

title: Sources: Gamecocks hiring TCU's Briles as OC
content: South Carolina is finalizing a deal to hire TCU's Kendal Briles as the school's new offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Monday.

title: Harper spoils Queen's triple-double in rookie clash
content: Dylan Harper came out on top in a clash of 2025 rookies despite Pelicans center Derik Queen's 33-point triple-double in a thrilling 135-132 Spurs win.

title: Barnwell sorts through NFL playoff race chaos: Are the Colts, Chiefs and Ravens finished?
content: Daniel Jones' injury, the Ravens' red zone woes, the Bears' defensive mistakes and the Chiefs' drop issues meant big changes in the race for the postseason.

title: What do Week 14 games mean for the rest of the season?
content: Our reporters react to the action, answering lingering questions and detailing what you need to know.

title: Will Daniel Jones start for the Colts in '26? Is the front office safe? Key questions for Indy
content: Will coach Shane Steichen and GM Chris Ballard survive a late-season freefall? What's next at QB in Indy?

title: Wetzel: Relax, the CFP selection process is (mostly) working
content: Don't overreact to this year's playoff rankings by blowing up the system. Chasing perfection is a fool's errand.

title: CFP Anger Index: An absurd farce over Notre Dame, Miami
content: Evaluating the committee's ranking process, and what teams should be most upset about in final CFP ranking.

title: Everything we know about the Heat's trade for Terry Rozier -- and whether he could be dealt again
content: Terry Rozier, who is scheduled to be arraigned Monday for his alleged role in a betting scheme, was traded to Miami in 2024 without any investigation being disclosed.

title: The NHL's best this week: Terry Ryan and hockey dreams
content: From first-round draft pick to iconic character, Ryan's path is a unique one. Plus, this week's key NHL games.

title: MLB winter meetings updates, rumors and predictions: The latest buzz from Orlando
content: From predicting who will sign to the latest buzz from Florida, here's everything you need as baseball's hot stove season heats up.

title: Who has the most travel at 2026 World Cup? And why does it matter?
content: For many national teams, how they handle and recover from extensive travel could make or break their World Cup next summer.

title: Men: New No. 1 after Purdue's shock loss
content: The fifth in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what's next for every team in the ranking.

title: How each of the 12 College Football Playoff teams could win the national title
content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

title: Free agents: Trevor Lawrence and Packers WRs among top options
content: All the free agent options worth adding as we look dive into Week 15 and the fantasy football playoffs.

title: Buzz: Etienne, Pollard and Godwin among players who were getting the ball on Sunday
content: Eric Moody's notebook highlights participation and usage trends that drove fantasy highs and lows on Sunday

title: What we know so far about Mo Salah's Liverpool future
content: One of the world's best players, Mohamed Salah looks set to leave Liverpool soon after venting his frustration at being benched. But what does the future hold for him?

title: In winning F1 title, Norris proves himself (and his doubters) wrong
content: Lando Norris doubted himself as a title contender earlier this year. Now, as the curtain falls on the F1 season, he can call himself a world champion.

title: Week 14 only added more chaos to the NFL playoff race -- "a bookmaker's dream"
content: Week 14 "set the tone" for many NFL teams as Super Bowl favorites faltered and underdogs picked up steam.

title: Early Week 15 bets: Patriots over Bills, Lions to cover in shootout with Rams
content: What lines offered value once odds came out? Here are five games we're eyeing for bets going into Week 15.

title: QBs Cam Ward, Shedeur Sanders swap jerseys after Titans' victory
content: The Browns and Titans rookies exchanged comical trash talk while swapping jerseys following Tennessee's 31-29 win at Cleveland.

title: Pickups: Ryan Nembhard, Quentin Grimes among players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: UFC 323 fight grades: Why Dvalishvili-Yan wasn't the best fight on the card
content: Which fights were the best and worst of the last UFC PPV of 2025? Andreas Hale grades every fight from UFC 323.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Neymar eyes Europe, MLS move for World Cup
content: Santos forward Neymar is set to consider a move back to Europe or MLS if he doesn't stay in Brazil. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: "She Voted After Citizenship": Priyanka Gandhi On Sonia Gandhi Poll Roll Row
content: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi on Tuesday dismissed the allegations against her mother Sonia Gandhi over the latter's name in the voter list before acquiring citizenship, and said that it was an "absolute lie".

title: "IndiGo Back On Its Feet, Ops Stable": CEO's Latest Statement Amid Crisis
content: The IndiGo airline, which sparked a massive crisis with countrywide flight cancellations for days, is "back on its feet", its Chief Executive Officer Pieter Albers said today.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Goa Nightclub Owner Gaurav Luthra's First Pic From Thailand
content: Gaurav and his brother, Saurabh, flew out to Thailand's Phuket on an IndiGo flight at 5:30 am on Sunday - just a couple of hours after the tragedy.

title: Who Is Rishima Sarin? Dhurandhar Puts Major Mohit Sharma's Widow In Limelight
content: Following his death, the army awarded the "next of kin" honours to his widow, Rishima Sarin, which created troubles within the family.

title: US, Canada To UK: A Look At 5 Biggest Immigration Crackdowns of 2025
content: In 2025, immigration dominated global discourse, with governments in several Western nations bringing in policies to curb the inflow of migrants.

title: 20 Killed In Fire In Seven-Story Building In Indonesia’s Capital Jakarta
content: A fire broke out at a seven-storey building in Indonesia's capital Jakarta on Tuesday, an official said on Tuesday, with 20 people confirmed dead.

title: Trumps Rice Tariff Threat: Wake Up And Smell The Basmati, Warn Exporters
content: US President Donald Trump's latest warning that he may impose additional tariffs on rice exports from nations, including India, is unlikely to have any major impact on Indian rice exports, especially of basmati rice, according to rice exporters.

title: "33 Drinks, Sedative": Lawsuit Blames Royal Caribbean Cruise For Man's Death
content: A California man's death aboard a Royal Caribbean cruise last year has been officially ruled a homicide after the family, in a lawsuit, claimed that he was over-served alcohol by the staff members.

title: Pope Leo, Indonesian Aura Farming Kid Among New York Times' 2025 Style Icons
content: Pope Leo XIV, the Indonesian aura farming' preteen and tennis star Naomi Osaka's Labubu were among celebrities, athletes and political figures, who defined what it means to be stylish this year.

title: "Nothing Changing Today": Netflix's Late-Night Email On Warner Bros Deal
content: The acquisition for nearly $83 billion would bring Warner Bros’ film and TV studios, along with HBO and HBO Max, under Netflix’s umbrella.

title: Amit Shah Rebuts Priyanka Gandhi On Vande Mataram, Slams Nehru, Indira Gandhi
content: Countering Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's charge that the NDA government proposed a parliamentary discussion on Vande Mataram with an eye on West Bengal polls, Union Home Minister Amit Shah today said the song is not restricted to Bengal

title: Video: Homes And Offices Shake Violently As 7.5-Magnitude Earthquake Hits Japan
content: A powerful magnitude 7.5 earthquake struck north-eastern Japan on the night of December 8, injuring at least 30 people and prompting the evacuation of around 90,000 residents.

title: CBI Files Case Against Anil Ambani's Son Jai Anmol In Rs 228 Crore Bank Fraud
content: The CBI has booked the son of industrialist Anil Ambani, Jai Anmol Anil Ambani, and Reliance Home Finance Ltd. (RHFL) in a case of alleged cheating in Union Bank of India that caused a loss of Rs 228 crore to the public bank, officials said.

title: "Anarchy Can't Be Allowed': Supreme Court Seeks Centre's Reply On Bengal SIR Security
content: "Anarchy cannot be allowed," Supreme Court warned on Tuesday as it sought responses from the Centre and the Election Commission of India on a petition demanding the deployment of Central forces  to protect electoral officers engaged in SIR in Bengal

title: Karnataka Congress Reignites Tipu Jayanti Row, BJP's 'Bin Laden Jayanti' Jab
content: Tipu Jayanti, first officially introduced by the Siddaramaiah-led Congress government in 2015, aimed to honor Tipu Sultan, the 18th-century ruler of Mysore.

title: Symphony Of Woofs: Argentina Hosts Golden Retriever Meet With 2,397 Dogs
content: A passerby could hear the cacophony from miles away in the Argentine capital, the unmistakable sound of 2,397 dogs barking - and breaking the unofficial world record for the largest-ever gathering of golden retrievers.

title: IMF Approves Additional $1.2 Billion For Pakistan Citing Economic Progress
content: The International Monetary Fund on Tuesday approved the release of $1.2 billion to Pakistan, giving the cash-strapped country a fresh boost as it works to recover from one of its worst economic crises in years.

title: Adani Group To Invest Over $75 Billion In Energy Transition Space In 5 Years
content: Adani Group chairman Gautam Adani on Tuesday said the conglomerate will invest over USD 75 billion in the energy transition space over the next five years

title: Resist External Pressures, Do Only What Is Best For India: Gautam Adani
content: India must define its own development path and resist external pressures, said Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Tuesday.

title: 'Vande Mataram' debate: TMC MPs hold silent protest against 'insult' of Bengal icons by BJP
content: The protest came a day after a discussion on 150 years of "Vande Mataram" was held in the Lok Sabha. The debate was initiated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Facing repeated defeats, Opposition finds flaws with EVMs, SIR: BJP MP in Lok Sabha
content: BJP MP Sanjay Jaiswal said that despite Opposition's claims that his party will benefit most from simultaneous polls, the reality is that it will possibly be the other way round

title: Delhi High Court ruled in favour of Ramadoss, Anbumani has nothing to do with PMK: G.K. Mani
content: Speaking to reporters at Thailapuram near Tindivanam, Mr. Mani said that the founder would continue to lead the party and decide on alliances for the upcoming Assembly elections

title: Goa government orders demolition of Vagator beach shack of Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra
content: Interpol has issued a Blue Corner notice against Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, according to the Goa Chief Minister's Office

title: Decision to use first two stanzas of ‘Vande Mataram’ was not of Nehru alone: Congress president Kharge
content: The Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge also quoted Tagore, who said he found "no difficulty" in dissociating the first two stanzas of the poem with the rest of the song

title: Bengal polls will be announced soon after publication of voters' list to block legal challenge: CM
content: Stepping up her attack on the Centre, CM Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP-led government of running an “anarchic and autocratic” regime

title: Delhi court notice to Sonia Gandhi, police on plea claiming ‘forgery’ in electoral roll inclusion
content: Issuing notice to Sonia Gandhi and Delhi Police, Judge Gogne posted the matter on January 6 for further proceedings

title: LDF convener in Kerala revives debate on SilverLine, BJP sees red
content: T.P. Ramakrishnan claims the Railway Ministry has come up with a new proposal for enhancing rail connectivity in the State.

title: Kerala CM defends support for survivor in actor assault case, says Dileep’s conspiracy allegation ‘only a perception’
content: Pinarayi says prosecution handled the case effectively and the verdict will undergo legal scrutiny before further action

title: ‘Investment in education and healthcare is usually underrated, but is actually one of the most significant contributors to upholding human rights’
content: Universal School of Law organises dialogue to address the question: Why India ranks high on GDP, but low on human rights

title: Electoral reforms possible only when ECI is impartial, says Akhilesh Yadav
content: Participating in a debate on 'Election Reforms', he made a slew of allegations to claim that the poll authority was not functioning with neutrality

title: No scarcity of key anti-TB drugs in central, State stocks: Union Minister
content: The Union Minister Of State for Health said that National Tuberculosis Elimination Programme is being implemented under the aegis of National Health Mission across the country

title: T.N. BJP condemns Opposition’s bid to move impeachment motion against Justice Swaminathan
content: The judge had ordered the lighting of a lamp at the deepathoon (pillar) located near a dargah atop the Thirupparankundram hill in Madurai

title: Capping MBBS seats by NMC deferred for academic years 2024-25, 2025-26: Nadda
content: The decision to postpone the seat capping aims to address regional disparities in medical education access, particularly in southern States, amid concerns from lawmakers and stakeholders

title: Kerala actor rape case: Hope court will give maximum punishment to the guilty, says actor-filmmaker Lal
content: Lal says it was him and not late Congress MLA P.T. Thomas who first informed then State Police Chief Loknath Behera about the survivor’s ordeal

title: DPIIT committee on AI and copyright suggests compromise position on data mining
content: Data crawlers for training AI models should not be restricted, a government working paper said. However, it added, all rightsholders would have to be paid for their contributions

title: CBI books Anil Ambani’s son, Reliance Home Finance Ltd. in ₹228 crore bank fraud case
content: The CBI acted on a complaint from the bank (erstwhile Andhra Bank) against Reliance Home Finance Ltd., Jai Anmol Anil Ambani and Ravindra Sharad Sudhakar, both directors in RHFL

title: A pause in Odisha: The sanctuary that feels like a secret
content: Two hours from Jharsuguda lies Debrigarh sanctuary run by tribal communities — we visit to discover boat safaris to Bat Island, stargazer suites, wildlife drives with chousingha, and crisp fried fish at sunset.

title: SIR hearing: Inclusion of CAA-protected refugees in electoral roll dependent on whether they meet conditions of naturalisation, says Supreme Court
content: The Court said that even though the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 have introduced changes in favour of granting persecuted religious minorities from these countries, every such claim would have to be enquired into and determined by the authorities

title: Rajasthan High Court receives fourth bomb threat; premises evacuated
content: All the threats received earlier had turned out to be a hoax; Additional Commissioner of Police (Crime) Manish Agarwal said the threats were sent to ‘create panic’

title: Division of Vande Mataram song led to partition of India, says Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah said Vande Mataram was the “mantra” that awakened India’s cultural nationalism, and remains as relevant today as it was during the freedom struggle

title: Number of Maoist-hit States, districts has considerably gone down in last 10 years, Lok Sabha told
content: Nityanand Rai, Minister of State for Home said the number of effected States have gone down to five from 10 while the number of districts hit by Left Wing Extremism have also gone down from 126 to 11

title: India must define its own growth path amid fractured global alliances: Adani
content: Delivering the keynote address at the 100th foundation day celebrations of IIT, Dhanbad, Gautam Adani said that nations across the globe were acting in pure self-interest, and India must master the energy systems that fuel its growth

title: The Kalinga Literary Festival with Penguin Random House India has launched a book review competition
content: Grand prizes include ₹10,000 for the winner and ₹5,000 for the runner-up, along with a hamper of Penguin books

title: Home Minister Amit Shah likely to visit Andaman & Nicobar Islands later this week: Officials
content: Officials have recieved preliminary information about Mr. Shah’s arrival on December 11 or 12 at the Veer Savarkar International Airport, but the final itinerary is awaited

title: Government cancels 5,371 licences of fertiliser firms for malpractices during Apr.-Nov., says  Nadda
content: The Minister said that the Centre has supplied fertilisers to every State and the supplies are monitored in real time through Integrated Fertiliser Monitoring System

title: Govt working on war footing to control pests, diseases affecting coconut plantations: Agriculture Minister
content: India ranks first in coconut production and Pollachi in Coimbatore is a major producer with coconut plantations spanning 1.2 lakh hectares, the Minister said during Question Hour in the Lok Sabha

title: INDIA bloc MPs submit letter to LS Speaker to move impeachment motion against Justice Swaminathan
content: The move comes against the backdrop of the Thirupparankundram row; INDIA bloc alleges Justice Swaminathan deciding cases on the basis of political ideology

title: Mamata Banerjee demands PM’s apology over ‘Bankim da’ remark in Lok Sabha
content: Mamata Banerjee said the Prime Minister was not even born when the country achieved Independence and yet chose to address one of Bengal's greatest cultural icons casually

title: ECI legally has no right to hold SIR, says Manish Tewari
content: Manish Tewari said that in India's democracy there are two stakeholders — people who vote as electors and political parties that participate in the poll

title: Maharashtra doctor’s death: Handwriting on note verified; policeman, techie involved in harassment, says CM Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis confirms harassment by a policeman and techie led to a doctor’s death, as handwriting verification supports her claims.

title: No airline, however large, will be permitted to cause hardship to passengers: Naidu
content: Making a statement in the Lok Sabha, Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu says ‘strict and appropriate action will be taken’ against IndiGo for the flight disruptions

title: Opposition leaders stage protest on Vidhan Bhavan steps over farmers' issues
content: On the second day of the Maharashtra Assembly's Winter session, Opposition leaders accused the government of delaying the purchase of soyabean, which resulted in farmers selling the produce well below the Minimum Support Price

title: SC seeks EC response on plea challenging ‘special revision’, and not SIR, in Assam
content: The petitioner questions why an SIR was not conducted in Assam, but is done in 12 other States and Union Territories; alleges the presence of ‘40 to 50 lakh illegal immigrants’ even in 1997.

title: Pleasant weather sets the stage for Kerala local body elections
content: With the weather turning pleasant, no weather stations in the State recorded rain events in the last 24 hours ending at 8:30 a.m. on Tuesday

title: Wishes pour in as Sonia Gandhi turns 79
content: Sonia Gandhi, the longest serving Congress president, has taken a back seat from active politics in the last few years due to health reasons

title: 'Vande Mataram' row: Congress cites historian's remarks referring to Tagore's advice on song, slams PM
content: Sugata Bose, in a video, said that it was on Tagore's advice that the Congress decided that at national meetings only the first part of the Vande Mataram song would be performed

title: Karnataka High Court recalls stay on one-day monthly menstrual leave for women employees; to hear government’s arguments on Dec 10
content: Petitioners said that there exists no provision in the concerned statutes to grant leave during menstrual cycle and hence the government had no power to introduce additional leave through a notification.

title: Kerala local body polls: A.K. Antony points to anti-incumbency sentiment, says even Left voters seek change
content: Speaking after casting his vote, Antony says ‘even Left-leaning voters are wishing for a shock treatment to the Left’

title: TVK to contest 2026 Assembly polls in Puducherry too, says Vijay
content: Mr. Vijay’s first public meeting in Puducherry was held on Tuesday under tight crowd control measures

title: Supreme Court hearing on SIR highlights: 140 crore people have to prove they are citizens, petitioners argue against EC
content: Tamil Nadu seeks extension of enumeration forms phase as many have travelled to Sabarimala and would be back only by Pongal

title: Marathon Day of engagements for CM Revanth as the Telangana Rising Global Summit concludes
content: Focus on education, power, life sciences, food processing, automobiles, electronics and AI; Vision Document to be unveiled this evening

title: Dileep’s acquittal in Kerala actor rape case echoes in poll-day chatter
content: UDF convenor Adoor Prakash reignited the debate centring on trial court’s decision to acquit Dileep of conspiracy charges, alleging that Kerala government was seeking to ‘further victimise’ the actor by deciding to appeal the verdict in High Court

title: NTR Jr. moves Delhi HC for protection of personality rights
content: The actor’s lawyer submitted that NTR Jr.’s personality rights were being violated with the circulation of several materials on social media platforms and e-commerce sites

title: Cluster-level federations of women’s SHGs promoting rural entrepreneurship in Rajasthan
content: Chief Secretary Srinivas interacted with the women entrepreneurs engaged in the blue pottery craft and the traditional hand block printing on cotton fabrics

title: New feature to identify duplicate voters launched on BLO apps in West Bengal
content: At least 56 lakh voters have been identified as “dead, duplicate, untraceable and shifted” in the State till now

title: Kerala local body polls: Fronts make fervent bid to sway electoral outcome on the day of ‘silent campaigning’
content: “Silent campaigning” unfolded across three Municipal Corporations, 39 municipalities, seven district panchayats, 75 block panchayats, and 471 grama panchayats spread over Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam, Idukki, Alappuzha, and Ernakulam districts.

title: Kerala local body polls: LDF–UDF locked in a neck-and-neck battle in Thrissur; BJP could tilt the scales
content: With an unpredictable electorate and shifting community votes, the district braces for a razor-thin verdict.

title: LDF vies for a coup in a district perceived a UDF bastion
content: Landslide rehabilitation remains the central electoral issue, extending beyond the three wards in Meppadi grama panchayat that have been directly affected. Allegations against both main fronts have become campaign flash-points

title: Kerala local body polls: Neck-and-neck fight in Palakkad as BJP, UDF, LDF vie for 53 seats
content: Rivalry within the BJP has reached a boiling point, and the party will not be surprised to lose a few seats. In the case of the Congress, while it insists that its house is intact and stronger than last year, concerns linger that the Rahul Mamkootathil issue can hurt its prospects. Meanwhile, the CPI(M) appears stagnant in Palakkad

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: Catholic Church says will support candidates who address people’s issues
content: The Church is not biased towards any political front in the State, says Idukki diocese media commission director

title: Kerala local body polls: BJP candidate R. Sreelekha shares pre-polls survey, courts controversy
content: General Education Minister V. Sivankutty said that Ms. Sreelekha’s action is a violation of the model code of conduct

title: Police question Chinese national for second day, as low-budget homestays come under scanner in Srinagar
content: Security agencies were following his digital footprint in Kashmir and Ladakh, where he toured recently. He had managed to procure a SIM card, “which is being investigated”, officials said.

title: Kerala local body polls: V.D. Satheesan predicts landslide win for UDF, cites anti‑incumbency and Sabarimala gold theft row
content: While the pattern of elections to the local bodies, Parliament, and the Assembly is different, there will indeed be signs of what to expect in the Assembly elections from this poll, he says

title: ED files prosecution complaint against Satyendar Jain, 13 others in DJB case
content: On December 4, in the same case, the agency attached assets worth about ₹15.36 crore of various persons.

title: Goa fire tragedy: Flagged illegalities about nightclub for years, says landowner
content: Birch by Romeo Lane, a popular party venue in Arpora village in North Goa, turned into a death trap on December 7 as a massive fire tore through the premises, killing 25 people, most of them staff and a few tourists

title: Parliament Winter session Day 7 LIVE: Biggest anti-national act is vote chori, says Rahul Gandhi in Lok Sabha
content: Congress MP Manish Tewari initiates the discussion on election reforms in Lok Sabha; Union Home Minister Amit Shah begins the discussion on the 150th anniversary of Vande Mataram in Rajya Sabha

title: India's Tata signs up Intel as first major customer for $14 billion chip foray
content: The electronics-manufacturing arm of the 156-year-old salt-to-software Tata group is investing about $14 billion

title: Census 2027: Registrar General of India asks States to appoint census functionaries by January 15, 2026
content: During the 2027 census, about 30 lakh field functionaries will be deployed to complete the task of taking the population count across the country within a fixed time frame

title: 58 IndiGo flight cancellations at Hyderabad airport on December 9
content: The airline cancelled 14 arrivals and 44 departures, marking the first occasion since December 4 that the daily tally of cancellations has fallen below 100

title: DGCA cuts over 100 IndiGo flights amid operational review
content: The regulator has asked the airline to assess the potential impact on its routes and flight schedules before a final decision is taken, a senior government official told The Hindu

title: Kerala local body polls: Polling for first phase under way in seven districts
content: Voters in Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam, Idukki and Ernakulam will cast their ballots today

title: Trump threatens tariffs on Indian rice, but trade metrics show pain will be felt by the U.S.
content: The U.S. accounts for about 3% of Indian rice exports, but Indian rice comprises about 26% of U.S. rice imports

title: After years of flood risk, Varadharajapuram residents hope for safer monsoons with new projects
content: The panchayat was one of the prominent residential neighbourhoods developed in the 1970s, with more than 70 different layouts; it now has many vacant plots, as the flood risk has prevented owners from building homes

title: Denmark envoy to India calls on T.N. CM Stalin
content: In another event, the recently reconstituted Backward Classes Commission’s chairperson and retired High Court judge V. Bharathidasan and members called on the Chief Minister in the Secretariat

title: Mamata says BJP leaders not aware of Bengal icons as Parliament discusses Vande Mataram
content: The Trinamool Congress took an offence to Prime Minister Narendra Modi referring Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay as Bankim da and said that “BJP is utterly alien to Bengal’s way of life”

title: MP Engineer Rashid seeks PM intervention ‘to end growing disconnect between L-G, CM’ in J&K
content: In the letter, the parliamentarian from the Baramulla Lok Sabha pointed out that the situation has started to create uncertainty among citizens and has slowed down decision-making on key developmental and welfare matters.

title: Chhattisgarh govt amends provisions on land valuation guidelines amid Opposition backlash
content: A good government is one that occasionally amends its decisions in the public interest. Certainly, there are some concerns regarding the guideline rates; they are being reviewed, says Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai

title: Renowned socialist leader Baba Adhav, 95, passes away
content: He had fought against caste system and for the rights of labourers, head-loaders, waste-pickers, and street vendors

title: SC relaxes former T.N. Minister Senthilbalaji’s bail conditions
content: He had a weekly-twice obligation to appear before the Directorate of Enforcement officer investigating a money-laundering case linked to the cash-for-jobs scam

title: SIR work being 'hindered': SC takes note of BLOs being threatened; asks EC to 'deal with situation'

title: A great night for Jeff Kent, but another stain on the Hall of Fame
content: the contemporary baseball era committee's Hall of Fame ballot announced Sunday night . if not for Barry Bonds, Jeff Kent might not be bound for Cooperstown . Kent was on the same ballot as Bonds -- who hit more homers than anyone, at any position .

title: 'Count all VVPATs or revert to paper ballots': SIR showdown in Lok Sabha — who said what

title: 🏈 CFP to Pop-Tarts: Picking every bowl game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: Women: UConn stays top, Big Ten has nine spots
content: the new AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the top 10 remained the same . Nebraska cornhuskers joined the poll, replacing the west Virginia Mountaineers . a weekend when the no. 1 team lost in college football and men's basketball, the Huskies easily avoided the upset bug .

title: 'Documents must've been forged': Court notice to Sonia over voter fraud; Priyanka rebuts charges

title: 'Birds aren't real': Chargers poke fun at Eagles after win, topping NFL Week 14 trolls
content: the Chargers beat the Philadelphia Eagles 22-19 in overtime . the team had multiple virtual jabs on deck after its huge victory . they referenced the "positivity rabbit" installed in the Eagles locker room last week .

title: These five players could help decide unpredictable East
content: the Eastern Conference is as unpredictable as any point in recent history . the upstart Detroit Pistons sit atop the standings at the quarter mark . it's too early to predict the contenders that will match up for conference supremacy in spring .

title: Man City have history of overtaking Arsenal; will it happen again?
content: pep Guardiola has revealed that their 3-0 win over sunderland was their best performance of the season . the gunners are two points clear of city at the top of the premier league table . aston villa are one point further back in third place following their 2-1 win against arsenal on sunday .

title: First round first look: How all eight teams can win
content: the college football playoff selection committee's final top 25 of the season produced a 12-team bracket that includes two regular-season rematches in the first round . no. 9 Alabama at No. 8 Oklahoma and no. 11 Tulane at no. 6 Ole Miss beat Alabama, 23-21, on Nov. 15 . the ACC's best team will have a chance to compete for the national title when no. 10 Miami travels to no. 7 Texas A&M .
